benchmark_details.name: AIMS.uk and AIMS.ca
benchmark_details.overview: AIMS.uk and AIMS.ca are newly annotated datasets from the UK and Canada to enable cross-jurisdictional evaluation of corporate compliance statements regarding modern slavery, facilitating the development of AI tools for compliance monitoring.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide annotated datasets for analyzing compliance with modern slavery legislation and to advance AI-assisted compliance checking frameworks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Limitations include the small size of the datasets and potential biases from manual annotations.

data.source: Modern slavery statements from UK and Canadian government registries.
data.size: 50 statements each for AIMS.uk and AIMS.ca with 2807 and 3658 sentences respectively.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on predictions made by models fine-tuned on the datasets.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better model performance in correctly identifying compliance criteria.
methodology.baseline_results: Fine-tuned models on AIMS.au achieve better overall results than zero-shot or few-shot models.
methodology.validation: Validation involves comparison of predictions against expert annotations.
